title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at both 2B and 3B during Red Sox spring training in Fort Myers.
Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora aims to solidify starting infield positions as spring training progresses.
Red Sox emphasize reducing errors, having committed the most in MLB in 2025 and second-most in 2024 and 2023.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant will stay in New England, declining NFL offensive coordinator interviews, per ESPN.
Ashton Grant significantly contributed to QB Drake Maye's development, aiding in a successful second-year performance.
Grant began his coaching career at Holy Cross and has held various roles with the Browns before joining the Patriots.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton's Matt's Barber Shop flooded on Feb. 10 due to a burst pipe, causing significant damage.
Customer Dietrich Warner started a GoFundMe, raising over $25,800 for the barbershop's recovery.
A benefit show is scheduled at O'Brien's Pub on Feb. 19 to support the barbershop's reopening efforts.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' starring Elizabeth Olsen is a romantic comedy now streaming on Apple TV.
'Dawson's Creek' is available on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi following the death of James Van Der Beek.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10, a reality dating series, is streaming on Netflix for Valentine's Day.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled that two storybooks on gender stereotypes fall outside a Lexington father's lawsuit on LGBTQ-friendly lessons.
The lawsuit focuses on LGBTQ issues, not gender stereotypes, and challenges materials conflicting with the father's Christian values.
The judge allowed the school to use the books 'Pink Is For Boys' and 'Except When They Don't' despite the father's objections.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will join Team USA as an injury replacement for Corbin Carroll if he passes his physical.
At 21, Anthony would be the youngest player on the team, joining outfielders Aaron Judge, Byron Buxton, and Pete Crow-Armstrong.
Anthony is the second Red Sox player on Team USA, alongside Garrett Whitlock, marking their first participation since 2013.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: A $20 million penthouse at Ocean House, Watch Hill, Rhode Island, is for sale, featuring a private beach access.
The 4,696 sq ft penthouse includes a 2,400 sq ft terrace with ocean views and luxury interiors designed by Leslie Holland Hecker.
The property offers access to a lap pool, gym, spa, and hotel dining, with membership to Ocean House Club included.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are 35-19 and second in the Eastern Conference entering the All-Star break with significant contributions from Jaylen Brown.
The team excels in both offensive (third) and defensive (second) ratings, key indicators of playoff success in recent NBA history.
Challenges include a 12-14 record in clutch games, raising concerns about their ability to perform under pressure in playoffs.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities including museum visits, outdoor adventures, and dining across its 15 towns.
Main attractions include the Cape Cod Rail Trail, Sandwich Glass Museum, and Herring Cove Beach.
Popular eateries and drink spots include Far Land Provisions, Devil’s Purse Brewing Company, and Truro Vineyards.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, 30, from Fuquay-Varina, NC, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Type 1 Diabetes research.
Lapczynski, diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes 23 years ago, is running for Breakthrough T1D, supporting research, technology, and advocacy.
Living with T1D, she aims to inspire others, including her daughter, by showing diabetes doesn't prevent achieving big dreams.
